definition: Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia
to arrive/most/to/until
the summer solstice

sentences.english: Though it went on year round, the height of cricket fighting was between the summer solstice and autumn equinox.
sentences.chinese: 虽然它了全年的高度板球战斗之间的夏至和秋分。

sentences.english: What cure method does solstitial dermatitis have?
sentences.chinese: 夏至皮肤炎有什么医治方法？

sentences.english: After the summer solstice, in anticipation of rain, a rain canopy can be torn.
sentences.chinese: 夏至之后，在期待一场雨，一场能撕破天幕的雨。

sentences.english: In some mountainous areas, the seasonal wheat becomes mature around the Summer Solstice.
sentences.chinese: 在一些山区，季节性小麦在夏至前后成熟。

sentences.english: Tomorrow will be the Summer Solstice.
Enthusiasts perform yoga in Times Square during an event marking the summer solstice on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 周二人们在广场上表演瑜伽，庆祝夏至的到来。

sentences.english: Ceremonies were held on the summer solstice .
sentences.chinese: 每年夏至日出时行祭礼。

sentences.english: AIM To study the chemical constituents of Lagopsis supina .
sentences.chinese: 目的研究夏至草的化学成分。

sentences.english: A ceremonial dance performed by amerindians at the summer solstice .
sentences.chinese: 一种由美洲印第安人在夏至进行的祭奠舞蹈。

sentences.english: In some provinces, there is the tradition of eating cold noodles on this day.
sentences.chinese: 在一些省份，夏至有吃凉面的习俗。

sentences.english: Residents of Yulin in Guangxi province consider the festival an ancient summer solstice tradition.
sentences.chinese: 在广西玉林，人们认为这一节日是夏至传统。

sentences.english: I had been right to come here, on the eve of the summer solstice.
sentences.chinese: 我在这夏至之夜到这里来便没错了。

sentences.english: After this day, the spot of the direct sunlight gradually moves southward.
sentences.chinese: 夏至以后，太阳直射点逐渐向南移动。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To explore the regulative effect of ethanol extract from Mrrubium incisum on lymph circulation.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨夏至草醇提物对淋巴循环的调节作用。

sentences.english: The solstice comes and goes, but the Sami reindeer herders are too busy to pay much attention.
sentences.chinese: 夏至来了又走了，但萨米族人忙得注意不到这些。

sentences.english: Xiazhi often represents the start of the hottest period of a year.
sentences.chinese: 夏至通常预示着一年最热时期的开始。

definition: Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August
Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
Xiaoshu or Lesser Heat, 11th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd July
Dashu or Great Heat, 12th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd July-6th August
Chushu or End of Heat, 14th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd August-7th September
Lixia or Start of Summer, 7th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 5th-20th May
Winter Solstice, 22nd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd December-5th January
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
solar term
Shuangjiang or Frost Descends, 18th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd October-6th November
Mangzhong or Grain in Beard, 9th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th June
middle ten days of July, the first of 三伏 sān fú, three hottest periods of the year
Guyu or Grain Rain, 6th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 20th April-4th May
three periods forming the hottest periods of summer, from mid-July to mid-August, namely: 初伏 (mid-July), 中伏 (late July to early August), 末伏 (mid-August)
same as 中伏[zhong1 fu2], last ten days of July and first ten days of August, the second of 三伏[san1 fu2], three hottest periods of the year
